section: The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees at their discretion and convenience. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: The statement that the customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees at their "discretion and convenience" directly contradicts the requirement that they pay the fees in a "timely manner" to avoid service interruption. If payment is truly at the customer's discretion and convenience, there's no clear obligation to pay within a defined timeframe, making the threat of service interruption ambiguous and unenforceable. There is an ambiguity in the text and is an in-text contradiction.

section: The term of this Agreement for the Hosted Site shall commence upon April 1, 1999 and shall continue for a period of six (6) months, unless earlier terminated in accordance with provisions hereof. This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon fifteen (15) days' written notice.
explanation: The contract states that it automatically renews for one month periods if no notice is given. However, it also says that either party may terminate the agreement "at any time" with 15 days notice. This creates a contradiction, because if the agreement automatically renews but either party can terminate at anytime, that makes the renewal meaningless. This is a structural flaw as it does not make sense to have an agreement that can get terminated any time while also automatically being renewed.

section: i-on will be liable under any circumstances for any lost profits or other consequential damages, even if i-on has been advised as to the possibility of such damages. i-on's liability for damages to the Customer for any cause whatsoever, regardless of the form of action, and whether in contract or in tort, including negligence, shall be limited to one (1) month's fees and the remaining portion of any prepaid fees.
explanation: This section contains a contradiction. The first sentence states that i-on will *not* be liable for any lost profits or consequential damages *under any circumstances*. However, the following sentence then limits i-on's liability for *any cause whatsoever* to one month's fees. If there is no liability for lost profits, the general limitation on liability wouldn't apply to lost profits, creating uncertainty about the full extent of i-on's protection from damages claims. The section's intention is unclear. This an ambiguity and inconsistency in text.
